p: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious illness caused by a novel betacoronavirus strain first recognized in December 2019. The etiological agent of COVID-19, SARS-CoV2, is structurally related to viruses responsible for severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS-CoV) and Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV). These coronavirus strains have been responsible for epidemics and high fatality rates in the past two decades. COVID-19 is an active global health threat with conflicting fatality rate reports, but it is known to be higher in hosts with preexisting medical conditions and/or advanced age [1].
